extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound brussels sprouts, thinly sliced lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces extra-sharp cheddar cheese, thinly sliced

title: Brussels Sprouts and Smoky Onions on Cheddar Toast
summary: Brussels Sprouts and Smoky Onions on Cheddar Toast might be just the side dish you are searching for. Watching your figure? This vegetarian recipe has 306 calories, 15g of protein, and 18g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.32 per serving. If you have paprika, cheddar cheese, multigrain bread, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 82%. This score is great. Try Smoky Brussels Sprouts, Fried Brussels Sprouts with Smoky Honey Aioli, and Smoky, Lemony Saut√©ed Shredded Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350. In a saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the brussels sprouts until they are just tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and pat dry.                                              Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the onion, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until just softened, about 5 minutes. Add the paprika, cover and cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until the onion is tender, about 10 minutes; add a little water if the onion dries out.                                              Add the brussels sprouts to the skillet and cook until tender throughout, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.                                              Arrange the toasts on a baking sheet and top with the cheddar. Bake for 2 minutes, until the cheese is melted; mound the brussels sprouts and onions on top and serve.

steps.step: In a saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the brussels sprouts until they are just tender, about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet.
Add the onion, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until just softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the paprika, cover and cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until the onion is tender, about 10 minutes; add a little water if the onion dries out.
Add the brussels sprouts to the skillet and cook until tender throughout, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Arrange the toasts on a baking sheet and top with the cheddar.
Bake for 2 minutes, until the cheese is melted; mound the brussels sprouts and onions on top and serve.
